numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The data includes people who are 15 to 24 years old.
2. The data includes people who are 40 years old or older.
3. Many people who are 15 to 24 years old are optimistic about the future.
4. Many people who are 15 to 24 years old believe that the world is becoming a better place with each generation.
5. Many people who are 40 years old or older believe that the world is becoming worse with each generation.
6. Some countries are optimistic in both age groups.
7. These countries are usually developing countries.
8. These countries advance their society rapidly.
9. Nigeria is such a country.
10. Kenya is such a country.
11. Ethiopia is such a country.
12. Zimbabwe is such a country.
13. Some countries had a glorious history of global success.
14. Some of these countries no longer hold their former position.
15. People in these countries do not believe that the world is becoming better with each generation.
16. France had the Napoleonic period.
17. The UK had the Golden Age.
18. Brazil is an outlier in the bottom right of the chart.
19. Mali is an outlier in the bottom right of the chart.
20. Brazil never had a period of leading the world.
21. Mali never had a period of leading the world.
22. The status quo in Brazil does not allow citizens to see a bright future.
23. The status quo in Mali does not allow citizens to see a bright future.
24. I ask what guidelines people use to judge whether the world is becoming better or worse.
25. This data does not include my country.
26. This data does not relate to me directly.
27. The headline is: Is our world getting better?
